stigmatised returned to India I have
waited for you patiently for 15 years
soon I shall swim out of the body and
onto the shining abode yoga ninda come
Sri Yukteswar voice on its Arlie in my
inner ear as I sat in meditation to my
Mount Washington headquarters traversing
ten thousand miles in a twinkling of an
eye
his message penetrated my being like a
flash of lightning fifteen years yes I
realized now it is 1935
I have spent 15 years and spreading my
gurus teaching in America now he recalls
me that afternoon I recounted my
experience to a visiting disciple his
spiritual development under Kriya yoga
was so remarkable that I often called
him Saint remembering babaji's prophecy
that America too would produce men and
women of divine realization through the
ancient yogic path this disciple and a
number of others generously insisted on
making a donation for my travels the
financial problem was solved I made
arrangements to sale via Europe for
India
busy weeks of preparation at Mount
Washington in March 1935
I had the self-realization fellowship
chartered under the laws of the state of
California as a nonprofit corporation to
this educational institution go all
public donations as well as the revenue
from the sale of my books magazines
written courses clashed tuition and
every other source of income I shall be
back I told my students never shall I
forget America at a farewell banquet
given to me in Los Angeles by loving
friends I looked long at their faces and
thought gratefully Lord he who remembers
thee as the sole giver will never lack
the sweetness of friendship among
mortals I sailed from New York on June
9th 1935 in the Europa to students
accompanied me my secretary mr. C
Richard Wright and an elderly lady from
Cincinnati miss Eddie blech we enjoyed
the days of ocean peace a welcome
contrast to the past hurried weeks our
period of
you was short-lived the speed of modern
boats had some regrettable features like
any other group of inquisitive tourists
we walked around the huge and ancient
city of London the following day I was
invited to address a large meeting in
Caxton Hall at which I was introduced to
the London audience by Sir Francis
Younghusband our party spent the
pleasant day as the guest of Sir Harry
Lauder
at his estate in Scotland we soon
crossed the English Channel to the
continent for I wanted to make a special
pilgrimage to Bavaria this would be my
only chance I felt to visit the great
Catholic mystic Therese Neumann of
Conor's rot years earlier I had read an
amazing account of Teresa information
given in the article was as follows
Teresa born in 1898 had injured in an
accident the age of 20 she became blind
and paralyzed she miraculously regained
her sight in 1923 through parish to st.
Teresa the little flower later Teresa
Newman's limbs were instantaneously
healed from 1923 onward Teresa has
abstained completely from food and drink
except for the daily swallowing of one
small consecrated wafer the stigmata or
sacred wounds of Christ appeared in 1926
on Teresa's head breasts hands and feet
on Friday of every week thereafter she
has passed through the Passion of Christ
suffering her own body all his historic
Agony's knowing ordinarily only the
simple German of her village during her
Friday trances Teresa utters phrases
which scholars have identified as
ancient Aramaic at appropriate times in
her vision she speaks Hebrew or Greek by
ecclesiastical permission Teresa has
several times been under close
scientific observation dr. Fritz Gerlich
editor of the Protestant German
newspaper went to conrath to expose the
Catholic fraud but ended up by
reverently writing her biography as
always whether in east or west I was
eager to meet a saint I rejoiced as our
little party entered on July 16
the quaint village of Kannan Roth the
Bavarian peasants exhibited lively
interest in our Ford automobile brought
with us from America and its assorted
group an American young man an elderly
woman and an olive hewed oriental with
long hair tucked under his coat collar
Teresa's little College clean and neat
with geraniums blooming by a primitive
well was alas silently closed the
neighbors and even the village postman
who passed by could give us no
information rain began to fall my
companion suggested that we leave no I
said stubbornly I will stay here until I
find some clue leading to Teresa two
hours later we were still sitting in our
car amidst the dismal rain lord I signed
complaining me why did they leave me
here if she has disappeared an
english-speaking man halted beside us
politely offering his aid I don't know
for certain where Teresa is he said but
she often visits at the home of
Professor works a seminary master at
extent 80 miles from here
the following morning our party mortar
to the quiet village of X Ted narrowly
lined with cobblestone streets
dr. words greeted us cordially this home
yes Teresa's here he sent her word of
the visitors a messenger soon appeared
with her reply though the bishop has
asked me to see no one without his
permission
I'll receive the man of God from India
deeply touched at these words I followed
doctor what's upstairs to the
sitting-room Teresa entered immediately
radiating an aura of peace and joy she
wore a black gown and a spotless white
headdress all over age was 37 at a time
she's seen much younger
possessing indeed a childlike freshness
and charm healthy well-formed
rosy-cheeked and cheerful this is a
saint that does not eat Teresa greeted
me with a very gentle hand shaking
we both beamed in silent communion each
knowing the other to be a lover of God
dr. words kindly offered to serve as an
interpreter as we seated ourselves I
noticed that Teresa was glancing at me
with a naive curiosity evidently Hindus
had been rare in Bavaria don't you eat
anything I wanted to hear the answer
from her own lips
no except a consecrated rice flour wafer
once every morning at 6 o'clock how
large is the wafer it is paper-thin the
size of a small coin shattered I take it
for sacramental reasons if it is
unconsecrated i am able to swallow it
certainly you could not have lived on
that for 12 years I live by God's light
how simple her reply how I'm Stan Ian I
see you realise that energy flows to
your body from the ether Sun and air a
swift smile broke over her face I am so
happy to know you understand how I live
your sacred life is a daily
demonstration of the truth uh turd by
Christ man shall not live by bread alone
but by every word that proceedeth out of
the mouth of God
again she showed joy at my explanation
it is indeed so one of the reasons I am
here on earth today is to prove that man
live by God's invisible light and not by
food only can you teach others how to
live without food she appeared a trifle
shocked I cannot do that God does not
wish it
as my gaze fell on her strong graceful
hands
Teresa showed me a little square freshly
healed wound on each of her palms on the
back of each hand she pointed out a
smaller crescent-shaped wound freshly
healed each wound went straight through
the hand the sight brought to my mind
distinct recollection of the large
square iron nails with Crescent tipped
ends still used in the Orient but which
I do not recall having seen in the West
the Saint told me something of a weekly
trances as a helpless onlooker I
observed the whole Passion of Christ
each week from Thursday midnight until
Friday afternoon at one o'clock her
wounds open and bleed she loses ten
pounds of her ordinary 100
one pound weight suffering intensely in
her sympathetic love theresa yet looks
forward joyously to these weekly visions
of her lord i realized at once that a
strange life is intended by god to
reassure all christians of the
historical authenticity of Jesus life
and crucifixion as recorded in the New
Testament and to dramatically display
the everliving bond between the Galilee
and Master and his devotees
professor words related some of his
experiences with a saint
several US including Teresa often
traveled for days on sightseeing trips
throughout Germany told me it is a
striking contrast while we have three
meals a day
Teresa eats nothing she remains as fresh
as the roads untouched by the fatigue
which the trips causes as we grow hungry
and hunt for wayside ends
she laughs merrily the professor added
some interesting physiological details
because Teresa takes no food her stomach
is shrunk
she has no exclusions but her
perspiration glands function her skin is
always soft and firm at the time of
parting I expressed to Teresa my desire
to present at her trance yes please come
to Connors bog next Friday she said
graciously the bishop will give you a
permit I am very happy you sought me out
in eichstätt Teresa shook hands gently
many times and walked with our party to
the gate mr. right turned on the
automobile radio the Saint examined it
with a little enthusiastic chuckles such
a large crowd of youngsters gathered at
Teresa retreat into the house we saw her
at a window where she peered out as
childlike waving her hand from a
conversation the next day with two of
Teresa's brothers very kind and amiable
we learned at the st. sleeps only to one
or two hours a night in spite of the
many wounds in her body she is active
and full of energy
she loves birds looks after an aquarium
of fish and works often in her garden
her correspondence is large Catholic
devotees writer for prayers and healing
blessings many seekers have been cured
through her of serious disease
her brother Ferdinand about 23 explained
that Theresa has the power through
prayer of working out of her own body
the ailments of others the Saints
abstinence from food dates from a time
when she prayed that the throat disease
of a young man of her parish then
preparing to enter holy order be
transferred to her own throat on
Thursday afternoon our parent he drove
to the home of the bishop who looked at
my flowing lock to some surprise he
readily wrote out the necessary permit
there was no fee the rule made by the
church is simply to protect Teresa from
the onrush of casual tourists who in the
previous years had flocked on Friday by
the thousands we arrived Friday morning
about 9:30 at Cana Rosh I noticed that
Teresa's little college possesses a
special grass roof section to afford her
plenty of light we were glad to see the
doors no longer closed but wide open and
hospitable cheer there was a line of
about 20 visitors armed with their
permits many had come from great
distances to view the mystic trance
Teresa had passed my first test the
professor's home by her intuitive
knowledge that I wanted to see her for
spiritual reasons and not just to
satisfy passing curiosity my second test
was connected with the fact that just
before I went upstairs to a room I put
myself into a yogic trance state in
order to be one with her until a Pathak
and television rapport I entered her
chamber filled with visitors
she was lying in a white robe on the bed
with mr. right following close behind me
I halted just inside the threshold
awestruck at a strange and most
frightful spectacle blood flowed thinly
and continuously in one inch wide stream
from Teresa's lower eyelids her gaze was
focused upward on the spiritual eye
within the central forehead the cloth
wrapped around her head was drenched in
blood from the stigmata wounds of the
crown of thorns the white garment was
readily splashed over her heart from the
wound in her side at the spot where
Christ's body long ages ago had suffered
the final indignity of the
spear thrust Teresa's hand were extended
in a gesture maternal pleading her face
wore an expression both tortured and
divine
she appeared thinner changed and many
subtle as well as awkward ways
murmuring words in a foreign tongue she
spoke with slightly quivering lips two
persons visible before her in her sight
as I was in a tomb and with her I began
to see the scenes of her vision she was
watching Jesus as he carried the cross
amidst the jeering multitude suddenly
she lifted her head in consternation the
Lord had fallen under the cruel weight
the vision disappeared in the exhaustion
of vervet pity
Teresa sank heavily against her pillow
at this moment I heard a loud thud
beside me turning my head for a second I
saw two men carrying out a prostate body
but because I was coming out of a deep
super conscious state I did not
immediately recognize the fallen person
again I fixed my eyes on Teresa's face
deathly pale under the rivets blood but
now calm radiating purity and holiness I
glanced behind me later and some mr.
right standing with his hand against his
cheek from which blood was trickling
dick I inquired anxiously were you the
one who fell yes I fainted at the
terrifying spectacle while I said
consoling you are brave to return and
look upon the sight again remembering
the patiently waiting line of pilgrims
mr. right and I saintly bade farewell to
Teresa and left her sacred presence
the following day our little group
mortared south thankfully we were not
dependent on trains but could stop the
Ford whenever we choose throughout the
countryside we enjoyed every minute of
our tour through Germany Holland France
and the Swiss Alps in Italy we made a
special trip to Assisi to honor the
apostle of humility st. Francis the
European tour ended in Greece where we
viewed the Athenian temples and saw the
prison in which the gentle Socrates had
drunk his death potion one is filled
with admiration for the artistry with
which the Greeks of everyone
I rot their very fancies in alabaster we
took ship over the sunny Mediterranean
disembarking in Palestine wandering day
and day of the Holly land I was more
than convinced of the value of
pilgrimage the Spirit of Christ is all
pervasive in Palestine I walked
reverently by his side at Bethlehem
disseminate Calvary the holy Mount of
Olives and by the river Jordan and the
Sea of Galilee our little party visited
the birth manger Joseph's carpenter shop
the tomb of Lazarus the health of Martha
and Mary the Hall the Last Supper
antiquity unfolded scene by scene I saw
the divine drama that Christ once played
for the ages onto Egypt with his modern
Cairo an ancient pyramid then a boat
down the narrow Red Sea over the vast
Arabian Sea lo India end of chapter
